intro: Tephrosia apollinea subsp. brevistipulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf tephrosia, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features slender, compound leaves with short, narrow stipules, giving it its subspecies name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow or greenish in color. This species is often found in grasslands and disturbed soils, thriving in tropical and subtropical regions.
